One command to host them all. Bring your search case to the cloud in minutes.
Tell us what you think: Survey

NOW gives the world access to neural image search with just one command.

  • ‚õÖ Cloud: We handle deployment and maintenance.

  • üêé Fast and easy: Set up your search use case in minutes with minimal effort.

  • üåà Quality: You provide the labels, NOW fine-tunes the model.

  • ‚ú® Nocode: Non-technical people can deploy with ease.

Read how Jina NOW is production ready.

Install#

pip install jina-now

If you need sudo to run Docker, use sudo to install and use Jina NOW as well.

Mac M1#

For the M1 we recommend using a Conda environment. In a new Conda environment:

  1. Run conda install grpcio tokenizers protobuf

  2. Run pip install jina-now.

Quick start#

jina now start

1. Choose your app. Currently, we support image or text search, but in future, we‚Äôll add many more options.

2. Choose your data source. Choose between demo datasets, a custom DocumentArray, local folder, or S3 bucket.

  • If you choose docarray.pull or DocumentArray URL, NOW asks for your DocumentArray ID or URL.

  • If you choose local path, NOW asks for the folder‚Äôs path:

3. Choose your deployment type. We recommend cloud deployment to run your app on our servers. Alternatively, you can deploy locally.

For local deployment, NOW asks where you want to deploy it and reads your local .kube/config and lists all Kubernetes clusters you have access to. If you don‚Äôt want to use an existing cluster, you can create a new one locally.

4. Follow the links. After NOW finishes processing, you‚Äôll see two links:

  • The Swagger UI is useful for frontend integration.

  • The ‚Äúplayground‚Äù lets you run example queries and experiment with your search use case.

Example of the playground.

Example of the Swagger UI.
